thread.title: Boston Red Sox Announce Manager John Farrell's Cancer in Remission
thread.title_full: Boston Red Sox Announce Manager John Farrell's Cancer in Remission

author: Louis Milman
title: Boston Red Sox Announce Manager John Farrell's Cancer in Remission
text:
Share Article 
Photo by Jim Rogash/Getty Images (BOSTON) -- The Boston Red Sox announced on Thursday that manager John Farrell's cancer is in remission.According to a press release , Farrell underwent post-treatment testing on Wednesday at Massachusetts General Hospital and it was determined that his cancer was in remission. Farrell was diagnosed with early-stage Non-Hodgkin's Burkitt lymphoma in August."I am extremely thankful for the outpouring of support I have received from the Red Sox, my family, friends, and fans throughout this process," Farrell said. "I look forward to getting back to work and bringing another championship back to Boston."Red Sox President of Baseball Operation Dave Dombrowski, recently hired after resigning a job with the Detroit Tigers, said that the team was "thrilled" to hear the news, and that they "all admire him for his strength and courage, and look forward to having him back as our manager."
